column5: Well I finally got out just went out on simcoe for some bass  it seemed calm at home but by the time I got to the lake it was blowing like crazy and big simcoe waves..oh well I will take what I can get I found some on a drop off.....caught a few on a fat free shad and some on a black and blue worm I had about 2 hours of good fishing then it just died......  I was by myself so I tried to hold the fish out as far as I could and snap the picture but it really didn't work too well  anyways here are a couple of them        I hope to get out a few more times before sunday when I go on my fly-in with cochrane air , I am really pumped for that
Terry...that second flick looks like quite a pig.  Enjoy your fly-in.  I just booked a fall trip to Belleterre, Quebec for September, so I know how you must be itchin to get there.  Cheers  Craig
Have a great time, Terry!!  Yeah, that Largie looks like a good one!
Nice bucket on the second pic Terry Have a great time on your fly-in and take lots of pics Leechman

If you only had a net man,or a guy fishing in the back of the boat with a camera eh? LOL  Nice fish bud.  Were you fishing that deep weed drop off you showed me a few years ago?  We really need to get out.Well not we,,,,,I I I I I I I I I
thanks all.........did I mention I hate to fly...LOL   yes Brian that's the place

That second one looks like it has some weight!Fat free shad you say? I bought that lure, thanks to the constant infomercials by Bill Dance. It sits in my tackle box and have yet to use it!Looks great for murky water.
I lost my last one today, citrus colour ....the large size..sure would like to find more
Mine is citrus colored too. How much you willing to pay?  We should have an OFC Lure swap or sale. I have so many lures and stuff I dont need or use.
